class_notes: This class covers cultural and clinical ideas about trauma from WWI to the present. Students should be prepared to discuss health outcomes brought on by combat, sexual violence, and other forms of traumatic injury.  We will learn the history of trauma through a careful study of fictional narratives, poetry, testimonials, philosophical essays, and clinical case-studies. We will also debate the consequences of our expanding sense of trauma in contemporary culture through popular notions of triggeredness, microaggressions, victimhood, safe spaces, etc.
course_description: We will cover cultural and clinical ideas about war and trauma from WWI to the present, including health conditions caused by combat, sexual violence, and traumatic injury. Discussions will include the expanding sense of trauma today through popular notions of triggeredness and microaggressions.
